CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 20, 1952, pg. 14, reads: "IKS OPEN HOUSE FEATURE - Mary Robinson, interpretive dancer, backed by drummers Lenier Jones, Willie Santroy and Norman Verse, was one of the featured acts in hour long show presented as part of the "Open House" celebration at the Irene Kaufmann Settlement last week. Music for the other acts was furnished by Pernell Gibson's combo, provided by Local 471, American Federation of Musicians.  Prior to the show about 300 visitors saw exhibitions of the craft, hobby and recreation activities which this Community Chest agency provides. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Interpretive dancer Mary Robinson wearing two piece leopard patterned costume, posed in front of conga drummers Lenier Jones, Willie Santroy, and Norman Verse for "Open House" performance in Irene Kaufmann Settlement
